javadoc:
A ScalarOverflowException indicates that some precision would be lost. If the operation was signed, unused bits did not match the sign bit. If the operation was unsigned, unsed bits were not all zero

@version 1999-03-31

methods.javadoc: Constructs a ScalarOverflowException with no detail message.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a ScalarOverflowException with no detail message.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a ScalarOverflowException with the specified detail message.

@param message The message.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a ScalarOverflowException with the specified
 detail message.

name: ScalarOverflowException
comment:
A ScalarOverflowException indicates that some precision would
 be lost.  If the operation was signed, unused bits did not match the
 sign bit.  If the operation was unsigned, unsed bits were not all
 zero
